definition: to keep the peace; to patch up a quarrel (idiom)
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
abbr. for Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region 寧夏回族自治區|宁夏回族自治区[Ning2 xia4 Hui2 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 qu1]/abbr. for Nanjing 南京[Nan2 jing1]/surname Ning
peaceful/to pacify/to visit (one's parents etc)

sentences.english: Honda has settled the strikes at its other two factories as well.
sentences.chinese: 本田旗下另兩起罷工，均以廠方息事寧人告終。

sentences.english: Now it was too late to smooth things over, even if he wanted to .
sentences.chinese: 現在即使他想息事寧人，也爲時太晚了。

sentences.english: Smoothing things over is practically a profession to mothers of families.
sentences.chinese: 息事寧人可說是家庭主婦的專職。

sentences.english: Yao Ming killed off the phone, in groups, to stop their noisy.
sentences.chinese: 耀明息事寧人，將電話放在羣組，才停止她們吵鬧。

to capitulate

to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret

to threaten/to blackmail
